title: Splatana Wiper RUS-T
content:
The Splatana Wiper RUS-T is a main weapon in the Splatoon series. It is a Barazushi-branded variant of the the Splatana Wiper from the Splatlands Collection and features a different sub and special weapon.

- 1 Appearance

- 2 Splatoon 3

The Splatana Wiper RUS-T is similar to the appearance of the Splatana Wiper, albeit with its handle and frame painted brown to resemble a rusty "finish". The handle has a packet resembling a field ration packet stamped with Barazushi's logo attached to it. The frame has white painted text whose meaning is unknown. Traces of oxidized green paint are visible on various parts of the weapon.

The Splatana Wiper RUS-T was revealed on the Splatlands Collection update trailer, for the 10.0.0 version of the game. Its set is Curling Bomb and Trizooka.

- The Splatana Wiper RUS-T is a lightweight weapon.

- The matchmaking range is 13. The game's matchmaking system looks at a team's average matchmaking range value, and matches them against a team with a similar average.

- The Splatana Wiper RUS-T fires projectiles as it swings.

- The Splatana Wiper RUS-T can lunge forward if the user performs a charge slash while moving forward on the ground.

- The Splatana Wiper RUS-T cannot store its charge.

- The ink consumption of 3% per slash allows the user to slash 33 times per ink tank.

- After slashing, there is a 30 frame cooldown before the ink tank starts refilling.

- While slashing, the user's speed is set to 0.0945 units per frame.

- The projectile of the slash deals 30 damage, and the blade itself deals 15 damage, for a combined total of 45 damage.

- The projectile hitbox consists of 3 smaller hitboxes that become larger the closer they are to the center of the projectile. The center hitbox has a radius of 0.3 units, and the edge hitboxes have a radius of 0.3 units. The hitboxes cover a total width of 2 units.

- The projectile travels at 3.3 units per frame for 4 frames and spawns 1.4 units in front of the user, combining for a total distance of 14.9 units.

- The blade hitbox extends about 2.7 units in front of the user, and about 1.2 units to either side of the user.

- The time between continuous slashes is 16 frames.

- The user can submerge in ink 15 frames after the slash starts.

- The blade hitbox appears 3 frames after the slash starts, and the projectile appears 6 frames after the slash starts.

- The ink consumption of 6% per slash allows the user to slash 16 times per ink tank.

- After slashing, there is a 30 frame cooldown before the ink tank starts refilling.

- While charging or slashing, the user's speed is set to 0.0945 units per frame.

- The projectile of the slash deals 60 damage, and the blade itself deals 120 damage, for a combined total of 180 damage.

- The projectile hitbox consists of 7 smaller hitboxes that become larger the closer they are to the center of the projectile. The center hitbox has a radius of 0.5 units, and the edge hitboxes have a radius of 0.3 units. The hitboxes cover a total height of 3 units.

- The projectile travels at 1.2 units per frame for 14 frames and spawns 0.8 units in front of the user, combining for a total distance of 18.1 units.

- The blade hitbox extends about 3.3 units in front of the user, and about 0.25 units to either side of the user.

- It takes 14 frames to fully charge the weapon.
If the user is out of ink, then it takes 42 frames to fully charge the weapon.

- If the user is out of ink, then it takes 42 frames to fully charge the weapon.

- The swing animation lasts for 22 frames.

- The blade hitbox appears 3 frames after the slash starts, and the projectile appears 6 frames after the slash starts.

- Lunges cover a distance of 2.0 units.

- After 4 frames of startup, the lunge lasts for 3 frames. The blade hitbox appears after 14 frames, and the projectile appears after 17 frames.
The total animation lasts for 33 frames, after which the weapon can be used again.
The user can submerge in ink 22 frames after the animation starts.

- The total animation lasts for 33 frames, after which the weapon can be used again.

- The user can submerge in ink 22 frames after the animation starts.

- If the user is out of ink, then it takes 42 frames to fully charge the weapon.

- The total animation lasts for 33 frames, after which the weapon can be used again.

- The user can submerge in ink 22 frames after the animation starts.

[1][2]

Don't let its looks fool you - the Splatana Wiper RUS-T isn't old or rusty. It's just painted to look that way by Barazushi! Underestimate this weapon at your own risk, especially paired with Curling Bombs that allow the user to quickly advance before taking out foes with a charged slash. And for those just out of range? Let the Trizooka special be your great equalizer. This set really lets the Splatana Wiper shine, despite its appearance. Swing away!

Promotional video (link to file)

The brand stylization suffix "RUS-T" is derived from rust (or rusty, if the letter T is pronounced separately as its hyphenation could suggest), referring to the weapon's ostensibly rusted appearance.
